Class Expression

java.lang.Object
kalkulacka.Expression
public class Expression extends Object
Box class for creating and differencing Solver instances.
See Also:
  • Solver

  • Field Details

    • solve

      public final Solver solve
      Access point for solver class.

  • Method Details

    • solve

      public double solve()
      Easier access to solve method. This is the same as calling Solver.solve()
      Returns:
      double value, of calculated expression.
      See Also:
      • Solver.solve()

    • craeteExpression

      public Expression craeteExpression(String input)
      Used instead of constructor to create expression. In it is called createExpression(kalkulacka.Expression, java.lang.String) creating from ones instance. The only method used within the class instance. Not a static function. This method is recommended to use, when creating new classes.
      Parameters:
      input - the user input, to by processed.
      Returns:
      a Expression class instance, for calculating the input.

    • createExpression

      public static Expression createExpression(Expression from, String input)
      Used instead of constructor to create expression. Creates new expression based on data from last.
      Parameters:
      from - the instance to be taken data from.
      input - the String representation of user input.
      Returns:
      a Expression class instance, for calculating the input.

    • createExpression

      public static Expression createExpression(String input)
      Used instead of constructor to create expression. Creates new expression based on data from last. This method is recommended to use, when new chain of expressions begins.
      Parameters:
      input - the String representation of user input.
      Returns:
      a Expression class instance, for calculating the input.

    • createExpression

      public static Expression createExpression()
      Initialize new not null class, that can't be used for computing.
      Returns:
      a empty Expression.
